results.title: Tram
results.brief_description: It’s been a long day. Its hot, you’re tired, you feel like a sardine stuffed into a tin can and you just want to get home. The tram conductor from hell is not helping matters. The strangest things happen on public transport.

results.title: No. 1 On the Charts : A Look at the Australian Pop Music Industry
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Don Fitzsimmons
results.brief_description: Lee Simon, Basia Bonkowski, Jane Clifton and Michael Gudinski are interviewed in a forum style program about their views on the presentation of popular culture in the media. Video clips are interposed throughout the program.

results.title: Not Crippled, Not Useless
results.brief_description: Michael Briffa is fourteen and will probably be confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life. This program explores Michael’s determination and success in being allowed to enrol in an ordinary school. As well, Michael’s parents discuss their attitudes to special schools.

results.title: Versatility in glass
results.brief_description:
Public relations film outlining the nature of glass: how it is made; how it can be used in its many and varied forms for decoration, safety and protection in the home, industry and transportation.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Khmer! Khmer!: Cambodia in conflict (D)
results.creator_credit: Experimental Film and Television Fund, ABC and James G. Gerrand
results.brief_description: Portrays the life, culture, history and politics of the Cambodians. Focuses on Norodom Sihanouk’s abdication from the throne and becoming the first Democratic Leader of Cambodia, thus destroying the old feudal system and through to social and political destruction during the Vietnam War. Narrated by Richard Oxenburgh. WARNING: Contains graphic scenes of war related deaths.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, United States. Dept. of Defense, William L. Hendricks and George Waggner
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: Kampuchea: the long road back
results.creator_credit: Canterbury Productions, Leonard Teale and John Wall
results.brief_description: Commissioned by the sponsors of the Kampuchean Relief Appeal this made for television documentary shows how donations to International Relief Aid were used to bring aid to Kampuchea. Also records the plight of Kampucheans still struggling for survival after the death and destruction caused by the Pol Pot regime. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Maps Against the World (2016)
results.credit_line:
Director: Woo-Suk Kang

Writers: Jung-mi Choi (screenplay); Beom-shin Park (novel)

Starring: Seung-Won Cha; Shin Dong-mi; Kim In-kwon
results.brief_description: Director Woo-Suk Kang’s 2016 documentary tells the story of the real cartographer Kim Jeong-Ho who mapped the islands of Korea in the nineteenth century. In a period when only royalty and governments held the knowledge held in maps, Jeong-Ho wanted to make maps to empower ordinary Koreans to mark their land and to travel safely. Maps embody knowledge, in stories and beyond.

constellations_other.name: The narrative power of maps
constellations_other.description: Maps are designed to communicate complex information in a clear manner to aid both navigation and wayfinding and knowledge of place.

results.description: Director Woo-Suk Kang’s 2016 film tells the true story of the 19th century cartographer Kim Jeong-Ho, who mapped the islands of Korea. In a period when only royalty and governments held the knowledge held in maps, Jeong-Ho wanted to make maps to empower ordinary Koreans to mark their land and to travel safely. Maps embody knowledge, in stories and beyond.

results.title: Flight of the Amazon Queen for PC
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case with insert, manual, registration card and installation guide in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Science supervillains are popular across genres, and evil Dr Ironstein from Flight of the Amazon Queen is just such a nefarious mastermind. He has a secret underground bunker with a high-tech lab where he has developed the dino-ray to create an army of dinosaur women with which he plans to rule the world.

constellations_primary.name: Doctors of Evil
constellations_primary.description: Everyone loves villains. They get all the best lines and if they are mad scientists, they get all the best toys too. Evil Dr Ironstein from Flight of the Amazon Queen is just such a nefarious mastermind - one member of long lineage of science supervillains.

constellations_primary.name: Gender bending larrikins
constellations_primary.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

results.title_for_label: Flight of the Amazon Queen for PC
results.description:
Flight of the Amazon Queen is a point and click adventure where you play Joe King as he uses his plane, the Amazon Queen, to fly famous actress Faye Russell to a film shoot. When the plane crash lands in a remote jungle, and he must use his wits to battle his way out of the dangers he faces.

As with many point and click adventures, a set of icons at the bottom of the screen allows the player to interact with other characters or the environment. The game has since been ported to smartphones, with the addition of improved graphics, full voice acting, multi-language support and a play through of the interactive interview mini-game with audio commentary by John Passfield, one of the game’s designers.
description_for_label:
Flight of the Amazon Queen is a point and click adventure where you play Joe King as he uses his plane, the Amazon Queen, to fly famous actress Faye Russell to a film shoot. When the plane crash lands in a remote jungle, and he must use his wits to battle his way out of the dangers he faces.

As with many point and click adventures, a set of icons at the bottom of the screen allows the player to interact with other characters or the environment. The game has since been ported to smartphones, with the addition of improved graphics, full voice acting, multi-language support and a play through of the interactive interview mini-game with audio commentary by John Passfield, one of the game’s designers.
